page.title: 06Industry
page.content: The area includes an industrial estate which was the first created to serve the expanding town of Wellingborough which was receiving people in an overspill agreement with the Greater London Council. Firms, which were mainly of the light industrial type, moved into the estate because of the good communications with the rest of the country through motorway and rail. The firms on the estate have prospered and expanded and now employ considerably more people, many of whom are indigenous area, and are exporting their products all over the world. We were told by several of the firms that they were still expanding and trading well despite the national recession.
